The following providers shall be eligible for participation in MEIP: Eligible professionals as identified in Subsection 8900.3; and Eligible hospitals as identified in Subsection 8900.5. An eligible hospital shall be one (1) of the following: An acute care hospital located in the District of Columbia; or A children’s hospital located in the District of Columbia. For each year of MEIP participation, an eligible provider shall meet all of theollowing requirements: Have no current or pending sanction identified by the United States Departmentf Health and Human Services, Office of Inspector General or the District ofolumbia list of excluded providers; Declare the intent to participate by electronically registering with the CMSsing the Medicare and Medicaid electronic health record incentive programegistration and attestation website; Use the District of Columbia State Level Registry to attest to the provider’sualifications to receive the incentive payment; and submit an electronic copyf a signed attestation form at http://dc.arraincentive.com; Meet Medicaid patient volume requirements consistent with the requirements ofection 8901, “Methodology for Volume Requirements”, and the District ofolumbia State Medicaid Health Information Technology Plan (SMHP); Submit a Certified Health IT Product List (CHPL) Product Number; and Declare, if applicable, the intent to reassign incentive payments to a thirdarty subject to the requirements of 42 C.F.R. § 495.10(f). For the first year of MEIP participation, an eligible provider shall meet theequirements of Subsection 8900.6 and meet one (1) of the following conditions: Demonstrate and attest to adopting, implementing or upgrading EHR technology asefined in 42 C.F.R. § 495.302 that has been certified by the Office of theational Coordinator for Health Information Technology; or Demonstrate that it is a meaningful EHR user as defined in 42 C.F.R. § 495.4. In the second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth year of MEIP participation, anligible provider shall satisfy all of the following criteria: Meet the requirements of Subsection 8900.6; Demonstrate that it is a meaningful EHR user as defined in 42 C.F.R. § 495.4;nd Use certified EHR technology interoperable with the system designated by theistrict to report clinical quality measures.
